entry.title: The Week In Review 283
entry.content:
“Flickering green/ a hint of orange/ the night is gone.”

How much did you spent on your last piece of outdoor gear? And how much did you support your favourite blogs in the last months? If you enjoy The Week in Review & other articles buy me a coffee - I work Full-Time on Hiking in Finland to bring you inspiring trip reports, in-depth gear reviews and the latest news from the outdoors. You also could subscribe to the rarer-than-ever Newsletter and follow along on Instagram, Twitter and Youtube for more outdoorsy updates!

Outdoor News

Poland violated EU laws by logging in Białowieża forest, court rules.

Better Technology isn’t the Solution to Ecological Collapse.

Great news for nature: The EU passes a total ban on bee-harming pesticides.

Yay, I announced the Cottages Interviews 2018 Series! If you like ultralight gear makers you definitely should subscribe via RSS to not miss these!

The Outdoor-Spirit Podcast #38 is out and talks about Glamping. [German]

Should we be crowdfunding resuces?

Yoga for hikers. [German]

Something to look forward to: Life gets better after 50 (Why age tends to work in favour of happiness).

How to Lightpaint with Steel Wool.

An Ode to the Instagram Backpacker.

Learn to understand the Golden Hour, Blue Hour and Twilights.

SmugMug bought Flickr.

Revelate Designs launched a new seat pack, the Terrapin System 8L.

Garmin unveiled the new inReach Mini.

Impressions from the DLGM II.

Check out the new LiteSkin backpacks from Katabatic Gear.

Buy a Hyperlite Mountain Gear Backpack and get a free Pod to organize your gear!

You want to vote with your £$€ when you buy gear and buy from companies which think about social and environmental matters? You can now shop by sustainability attributes on the REI website, for example by searching for “Made in USA” “fair trade” or “Organic Cotton”.

Win a Salomon Multisport Outfit in this Photo Contest.

Stay at the Explorer Hotel Kitzbühel and get a sweet adidas terrex apparel outfit in this contest.

Win a trip to the Wilder Kaiser Region and Deuter kit.

And finally, win 500€ worth of Icebreaker Cool-Lite garments for your next adventure!

Check out the new arrivals at Backcountry.

Summer is here, and so are the new hiking trousers for this season.

Trip Reports

Agnieszka is hitting the trail again! This year she will be hiking the Continental Divide Trail. [Polish]

Drew hikes to El Montanon Peak.

Desert Trail: Death Valley.

Hiking the Hiline Trail.

Backpacking on Bornholm. [Danish]

It was a Big Sky Saturday.

The Dalliance of Eagles.

How time flies.

A hike up Mt. Tenmoku 天目山.

Thru-Hiking the Oregon Coast Trail.

7 Packrafting trips in Croatia. [German]

Packrafting in Russia. [Spanish]

Read the John Muir Trail Northbound Guide before hiking it!

Bombtrack on the Romagna Bike Trail.

Bikepacking with Keith Richards.

And some beautiful impressions from Willem’s 2017 Greenland adventures.

Gear Reviews

Matthias embarked on an epic bikepacking tour across Europe - here’s the gear he has along. [German]

The Great Outdoors reviews the OS Aventura GPS.

Read Kat’s Te Araroa Gear Debrief before heading to New Zealand.

Chris reflects on Gear for Long-Distance Walks Then & Now.

Martin’s gear list for his 1370 km Hoamatroas hike. [German]

First impressions of the Kojin Stove.

Alex helps you sew a breathable bivy bag and a 1P Tarp. [German]

First impressions of the Atom backpack from Atom Packs.

Ken reviews the Gossamer Gear The One.

What’s in your tool kit?

entry.title: The Week In Review 281
entry.content:
“Simplicity is the key to brilliance.” - Dieter Rams

How much did you spent on your last piece of outdoor gear? And how much did you support your favourite blogs in the last months? If you enjoy The Week in Review & other articles buy me a coffee - I work Full-Time on Hiking in Finland to bring you inspiring trip reports, in-depth gear reviews and the latest news from the outdoors. You also could subscribe to the rarer-than-ever Newsletter and follow along on Instagram, Twitter and Youtube for more outdoorsy updates!

Outdoor News

Sitting. Not Doing.

Yama Mountain Gear has launched their first backpack, the Sassafras 20. If you want one, be quick as there’s 25% off on the first 25 orders of the pack!

There’s a new Tarptent coming, the Notch Li.

Nine days left to get a Kokopelli Rogue Packraft on Kickstarter.

And Six Moons Designs comes out with a new backpack, The Minimalist.

I’m proud to announce that I am a Drobo Explorer. Stay tuned for a video on why I like the Drobo 5D3. And if you are going to the Photography Show at NEC in Birmingham you can take £3 off your ticket with the code “DROBTPS18”.

Britain’s national parks are a farce.

The hypocrisy of Leave No Trace.

If you rely on Facebook for traffic, consider this story.

Instagram is littered with #sponsored posts and the same photos over and over again. Time to leave?

The British Brand Finisterre attains B Corp status.

Bikepacker and BIKEPACKING.com have joined forces - congratulations!

Ortovox makes some great gear, and some of that you can win in this competition. You just have to answer one question!

And here’s a competition for the climbers, where you can win a rope, harness and some more goodies by sharing a great climbing photo.

If you need a pack for a quick overnighter, peak bagging or a leisurely day hike check out the ULA Equipment Fastpack.

Spring is coming, and with it the rain. Time to get The Shell from Hyperlite Mountain Gear, a 146 g light hardshell.

And lots of garments and gear at Alpinetrek.co.uk are up to 60% off, so check your closet if you need something for the next season.

Trip Reports

Vlog 002 and Vlog 003 are online, check them out!

Cam helps you planning your Arthur Range Traverse in Tasmania.

Go to Italy and bikepack on the Alta Via dei Monti Liguri.

Max bites off more than he can chew.

Ski-touring the Graubünden Haute-Route.

Bikepacking in Colombia, from Mompox to San Antonio.

All the info you could need in this Lake O’Hara Trail Guide.

My friend David tries Indian Street Food in in Chandni Chowk.

Henryk goes skitouring in Tirol.

Utah’s Tushar Mountains, crushed.

Get to know Pepper Cook and her basketpacking Tumbleweed Prospector.

Drew reviews the Cascade Mountain Tech Carbon Fiber Quick Lock Trekking Poles.

Kai shares his first insights on the Sony A7 III.

Shafted.
